member.name: P:ThreeRingsSharp.DataHandlers.Properties.WrappedChoiceOption.Directs
member.summary:
A reference to the s defined by the parent . Unlike typical behavior, this actually clones the directs for this option specifically and then returns the unique directs that contain this option's data.
(Under stock OOO behavior, a choice contains the data to apply to the direct, and then when the choice is selected, it applies its data to the parent directs contained in the choice object. In THIS object, each option contains its own personal directs rather than relying on editing the parent choice object.)

A delegate action that is called when the GUI needs to update. This can safely be for contexts that do not have a GUI, as it is used for the SK Animator Tools UI.
Pass in for arguments to make their data remain unchanged.
It is advised that you call this via as this protects cross-thread actions. This is designed to work with the UI offered by SK Animator Tools V2. The parameters are as follows:
string fileName (the name of the file that was opened)
string isCompressed (a string of true/false, yes/no, etc.)
string formatVersion (represents clyde file version. Classic, Intermediate, or VarInt for example)
string type (the base class, e.g. ModelConfig, AnimationConfig, ScriptedConfig)

member.name: T:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.SilkImage
member.summary:
An enum that represents the available icons in the data tree. Certain images are not part of the stock Silk image package.
Silk Images come from https://famfamfam.com/
To determine the icon of a TreeNode, simply cast one of these enums to an int and set ImageIndex to the int value.

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.SilkImage.Generic
member.summary: A blue square representing a generic object. Intended to represent an object of an unknown type.

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.SilkImage.Object
member.summary: An icon of a data tree with a single parent object containing two children. An alternative to that serves the same purpose.

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.SilkImage.Scene
member.summary: A picture of a the globe, intended to represent an entire scene, specifically a .

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.SilkImage.Sky
member.summary: A picture of the sky, intended to represent a skybox object, specifically a

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.SilkImage.Model
member.summary: A wooden box representing an entire model. Intended to represent a model.

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.SilkImage.ModelSet
member.summary: A set of three bricks, each with a unique color. Intended to represent a set of several models grouped together.

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.SilkImage.Articulated
member.summary: An icon of a person. Intended to represent articulated models, which have bones and often animations, specifically a .

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.SilkImage.Billboard
member.summary: An icon of an application window. Intended to represent a billboard GUI element.

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.SilkImage.Static
member.summary: A single building brick. Intended to represent a static model (just geometry and nothing else), specifically a .

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.SilkImage.MergedStatic
member.summary: A set of three building bricks. Intended to represent a bulk collection of several static models, specifically a .

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.SilkImage.Sound
member.summary: A picture of a speaker. Intended to represent a sound emitter object.

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.SilkImage.Attachment
member.summary: A picture of an electric plug. Intended to represent an external object that attaches to another model in its current context, for instance, the Thwacker Gremlin model has an attachment for their hammer. The hammer should use this icon in this context.

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.SilkImage.Derived
member.summary: A picture of two objects with arrows pointing between them. Intended to represent a derived model class, specifically a .

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.SilkImage.Conditional
member.summary: A picture of an arrow that diverges. Intended to represent an element that determines conditional attributes in gameplay, specifically a .

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.SilkImage.CameraShake
member.summary: A picture of a camera with a small lightning bolt in the lower right corner. Intended to represent an element that causes the user's camera to shake in gameplay.

member.summary: Whether or not VT Sequences are enabled and should be used.

member.name: M:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.VTConsole.EnableVTSupport
member.summary:
When called, this attempts to enable VT Sequence support for the console. Whether or not this action will be successful depends on the platform this code is running on.
This method will return if VT sequences are supported and were enabled, and if they are not supported on this machine.
VT sequences allow low level control of the console's colors, including the allowance of full 16-million color RGB text and backgrounds, bold/underline formatting, and more.
See https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/console/console-virtual-terminal-sequences for more information.
member.returns: True if VT sequences are supported and were successfully enabled, false if they are not.

member.name: M:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.ReflectionHelper.GetOOOConfigAndParameter(System.Object,System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
In the context of config maps, a returns a path relative to an OOO config file.
This method will attempt to resolve that path when given a and a configuration index (which is the name of one of the xml files in the spiral knights/config directory, e.g. "material" or "tile")
Assuming is a , this will call its getName() method (which returns its path), resolve the config data via , and return the object with the given name.
Given , it will attempt to call the getParameter() method on the returned config with an argument of this name, which should return the it's pointing to.
The first return value is the after resolution (which will be a specific reference type, like ), and the second value is the returned by ^.

Assuming is a , this will call its getName() method (which returns its path), resolve the config data via , and return the object with the given name.
Given , it will attempt to call the getParameter() method on the returned config with an argument of this name, which should return the it's pointing to.
The first return value is the after resolution (which will be a specific reference type, like ), and the second value is the returned by ^.

member.name: T:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.VersionInfoScraper
member.summary:
A hacky class that can read the raw binary of a Clyde file and find its implementation.
When files are read by , their implementation is cast into a , or is made null if that implementation doesn't exist. This is particularly problematic for Spiral Knights, where player knight models use the unique ProjectXModelConfig that does not exist in this library since Spiral Knights defines it instead. This class allows us to see that it's using this class.

member.name: M:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.VersionInfoScraper.HackyGetImplementation(System.IO.FileInfo,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
A very hacky method of returning the implementation of this model in its string form so that if Clyde can't read it, we can still see its name. This returns the full class name.
This is only functional for extensions of .

member.name: M:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.VersionInfoScraper.IsValidClydeFile(System.IO.FileInfo)
member.summary:
Returns if the input represents a file exported by Clyde. This tests the header of the file and searches accordingly:
Binary Attempts to find 0xFACEAF0E as the first four bytes, which is Clyde's header.
XML Attempts to find the Java Class Attribute (<java class="com.threerings.export.XMLImporter" [...]>) at the start of the file.
member.param: The file to verify as a Clyde file.

member.name: M:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.VersionInfoScraper.GetCosmeticInformation(System.IO.FileInfo,ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.ClydeFormat)
member.summary: Returns three , in order, the compression status (as a , "Yes" or "No"), the version name (user friendly), and the implementation.

member.name: M:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.VersionInfoScraper.GetDat(System.IO.FileInfo)
member.summary: Handles the input as if it's a binary .DAT file.

member.summary: Handles the input as if it's an XML file.

member.name: T:ThreeRingsSharp.XansData.MeshData
member.summary:
Represents mesh data. This is referenced by s to determine their mesh data.
In order to prevent formats that support unqiue objects from exporting the same mesh more than once, this class is used.
This allows multiple objects to represent the same mesh data rather than recreating it for every individual instance of the model.

member.name: P:ThreeRingsSharp.XansData.MeshData.BoneNames
member.summary:
A list of every bone name in this model that deforms the model (so NOT all of the bones)! Unlike the list provided in Clyde geometry, the first element (index 0) of this list is null.
This allows easier bone indexing when observing vertex groups since all that needs to be done is testing if the name is null (0 denotes "not in a bone group")

member.name: P:ThreeRingsSharp.XansData.MeshData.HasBoneData
member.summary:
This should be if this has bone data. If it is false, will not do anything.
Ensure this is only set to if , , and are all populated properly.
As a temporary fix for a number of issues caused by armors, this property's { ; } will only be able to return if all of the data associated with bones is correct (so setting it to without correct data will cause this to still return ).

member.name: T:ThreeRingsSharp.XansData.Structs.VertexGroup
member.summary: Represents a vertex group, which is used for rigged models. All stored vertices simply represent a vertex that has a weight in a given bone group. As such, if a vertex has a weight value less than 1, it will be a duplicate of at least one other vertex in one other vertex group.

member.name: P:ThreeRingsSharp.XansData.Structs.VertexGroup.Vertices
member.summary: All of the vertices stored in this VertexGroup, which all correspond to a specific bone. These ARE unique objects (not unique positions in space) since this is a representation of bone data. If you need to access the full geometry (and not every vertex used by a given bone), do it through . Do note that Weights are stored within vertices.

member.summary: The indices in this vertex group. These form triangles in this .

member.name: P:ThreeRingsSharp.XansData.Structs.VertexGroup.IndexIndices
member.summary:
The indices of elements in the parent . This is probably confusing to read, so think of it this way:
I access a value out of this list. The returned value int returnedValue = IndexIndices[x] is used to index the parent's data arrays (Indices, Vertices, Bone stuff): Parent.Indices[returnedValue]. Make more sense?

member.name: P:ThreeRingsSharp.XansData.Model3D.MultiplyScaleByHundred
member.summary:
Multiplies the scale of exported models by 100. This is really handy for a lot of models but may cause others to be huge.
This is by default since it's used more than it isn't.

member.name: P:ThreeRingsSharp.XansData.Model3D.ProtectAgainstZeroScale
member.summary:
If , any models that have a scale of zero will have their scale corrected. Cases where models are dubbed incorrect are:
- The matrix's scale (a ) only has its X value populated, Y and Z are zero. Y and Z will be set to X (this happens for cases where uniform scale is stored as a Vector3f)
- The matrix's scale has a magnitude of zero.
- The method returns zero, in which case, if the matrix has a non-zero uniform scale it will be set to this, or it will be directly set to 1.

member.name: P:ThreeRingsSharp.XansData.Model3D.Name

member.name: P:ThreeRingsSharp.XansData.Model3D.IsEmptyObject
member.summary:
If , this doesn't actually have any data and is instead an empty object with no data - it's just something that exists.
Note: While other data in this can still be set at any time, all data will be ignored by the exporter so long as this property is .

member.name: P:ThreeRingsSharp.XansData.XML.ConfigReferences.ConfigReferenceBootstrapper.ConfigReferences
member.summary:
A read-only map from a given type name (e.g. "tile", "placeable", or "material") to an object representing its implementation in the Clyde format itself.
Configs should be referenced like an array: ConfigReferences["tile"]
It can be indexed via a string name, which is the name of the file without .dat or .xml
It can also be indexed via type, such as via ConfigReferences[()]

Throws an if the given name isn't valid, and an if the given name is .

member.name: M:ThreeRingsSharp.XansData.XML.ConfigReferences.ConfigReferenceContainer.TryGetReferenceFromName(System.String)
member.summary:
When given the name of a specific entry (acquired via ), this will iterate through ALL configs and try to find it.
Warning: This will be slow if references were not prepopulated. It will cache what results it gets, however, so that should assist for repeated calls.
Returns if the reference could not be found.
Note: This will not have any arguments applied and will be populated with default data! You need to make sure you apply the arguments to this, and most importantly, MAKE SURE YOU CLONE THE RESULT OF THIS. Editing the template object may have unwanted side effects!
